intro: Alsine smithii, commonly known as Smith's alsike, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
